description: A collection of circles in a curved triangular formation with the point on the bottom; there is also a thin rectangular formation extending upwards from the top of the triangular formation and a thin almond-shaped formation extending out to the left from the bottom of the triangular formation. Each circle has a different number in the center denoting how many lines stem from that point. There is a pale orange triangle at the top of the triangular formation and a pale grayish-blue triangle in the center of the almond-shaped formation.

author.name: VertexArchive
author.description: An UNOFFICIAL archive of the New York Times' Vertex puzzle. This account is not affiliated with the NY Times. I just like the triangles.
